AD_Grave2.synopsis: Simple grave narration - Player is looking for "M.Kurwin" grave, so needs to stay close to that name. Wrong graves can be dug up and there will be incidental loot that makes the player feel slightly guilty for digging up the wrong one.

AD_NecromancerSummonsMyrkul.synopsis: Nina is an in training mage, that the player has helped to summon her brother back from the dead. Initially she is absolutely delight, and then she quickly realises the summoning has gone horribly wrong.

AD_CoffinMakerIdles.synopsis: Ulkov, the coffinmaker, is a busy man with very little time for shenanigans. He should move around a lot, muttering.

AD_PriestessHoodlumSolved.synopsis: Gracie muses happily that the hoodlums are gone. They were defacing a grave before, but the player has scared them off, somehow.

AD_KoboldAttack001.synopsis: Kobold looter in the graveyard combat AD - Normal dialog they can speak when attacking

AD_KoboldLooterInconspicuousWildshapeRea.synopsis: Kobold Looter has burst out of the coffin looting, only to find a wildshaped animal (inconspicuous) that has disturbed her.
AD_KoboldLooterInconspicuousWildshapeRea.how_to_trigger: - Dig up Kurwin's Coffin- Wildshape into a cat/raven- Interact with/break the coffin

AD_KoboldLooterInvisibleOpenReact.synopsis: Kobold Looter has burst out of their coffin looting only to find...nothing, because the player is invisible.
AD_KoboldLooterInvisibleOpenReact.how_to_trigger: - Dig up Kurwin's Coffin- Turn invisible- Interact with/break the coffin

AD_PriestessBellReaction.synopsis: Gracie walks past the grave that has a man buried within. She hears a noise but can't tell where it's coming from - it just sounds like muffled yelling to her.

AD_KoboldThrowsWeaponAtPlayer.synopsis: Bugthimble has just thrown Kurwin's Cauteriser at the player. It's a flaming mace. Not an ideal thing to have thrown at you.
AD_KoboldThrowsWeaponAtPlayer.how_to_trigger: - Read the Tough Letter from the courier- Get Bugthimble out of the grave- Intimidate her with Ninefingers knowledge- Intimidate her again with snout breakage

HiredHand02.synopsis: A hired hand you can convince to work for the woodworker. Definitely not an expy of the chucklebrothers.

BuriedMan.synopsis: Gothric Rillyn has been buried underground by Minsc after he tried to rob him. Player can hear muffled yelling from the grave and try to dig him out. This dialogue opens with Gothric having just pulled himself out of the hole (we don't see this in cinematic) and is now dusting himself down.

MourningDwarf.synopsis: A woman is mourning at a grave. She's looking to the future, eager for Gortash to take over and stop the killings, rather than mourning the loss of
MourningDwarf.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Mourning Dwarf woman in the graveyard

BereavedMother.synopsis: A mother that recently lost his child and has come to the graveyard with her husband to get a specially made coffin. Very dark, but gives the player a tiny sidequest they can complete to feel good about themselves (perhaps?)

AD_KoboldLooterLeavesWithLoot.synopsis: Kobold Looter has been left to loot and the player has stayed in the area for long enough to see them finish up
AD_KoboldLooterLeavesWithLoot.how_to_trigger: - Dig up the coffin- Open it and either:  - Be invisible  - Be a cat/raven  - Pay money to leave in peace- Leave Bugthimble alone for 1 minute without leaving the area

PAD_DarkUrge_Graveyard.synopsis: VB on entering the graveyard outside of Haven. Only for Dark Urge

AD_FlowerSeller.synopsis: The flower merchant out front, selling flowers on the approach to the graveyard, is trying desperately to attract attention while also trying hard to be respectful of the fact she's posted up by a graveyard.

AD_Grave3.synopsis: Simple grave narration - Player is looking for "M.Kurwin" grave, so needs to stay close to that name. Wrong graves can be dug up and there will be incidental loot that makes the player feel slightly guilty for digging up the wrong one.

KoboldLooter.synopsis: Automatically initiated dialogue after players bash/prise open a coffin with Bugthimble, a tetchy and mistrustful Kobold, just trying to live her best life looting the coffin and the nasty adventurers dug her upt! She wears a face covering helmet.Players have either dug here expecting to find "Enough valuables to settle matters between us" as the note they found said (Tough letter, found on the Courier by Scratch) or just decided to dig up a grave for fun.
KoboldLooter.how_to_trigger: - Find the coffin by either knowing about the note and finding the specific grave, or by going on a looting spree in a graveyard- Dig it up and open it for a surprise Bugthimble!Bookmark: larian://bookmark?name=BGO_KurwinCoffin&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-1744.178589;42.883114;706.366821&camTarget=-1743.758667;42.415478;705.588989

PriestessAndNecromancer.synopsis: Scyre, Mortach of Kelemvor, has been told that a little girl is practicing Necromancy in the graveyard. This is when you catch up to them both, and you get one last chance to intervene. In this dialogue you can encourage Nina to stop her Necromancy, threaten her, or even convince her to try again later.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved.synopsis: The Mortach speaks with the bereaved couple, who are relieved that their daughter now has a coffin. She is very much here to comfort and guide them during this difficult time.

AD_Grave4.synopsis: Simple grave narration - Player is looking for "M.Kurwin" grave, so needs to stay close to that name. Wrong graves can be dug up and there will be incidental loot that makes the player feel slightly guilty for digging up the wrong one.

AD_KoboldLooterSummonsGang.synopsis: Kobold Looter summons new kobolds to ambush the players, because they dared to try and loot/confront the mighty Bugthimble
AD_KoboldLooterSummonsGang.how_to_trigger: - Dig up Kurwin's Coffin- Do anything to get the Kobold into combat- Bugthimble will summon them on her first turn

AD_BuriedManBell.synopsis: Gothric is imprisoned underground in a shallow grave and is frantically trying to yell for help. His voice is muffled due to being, well, buried alive.

AD_Grave5.synopsis: Simple grave narration - Player is looking for "M.Kurwin" grave, so needs to stay close to that name. Wrong graves can be dug up and there will be incidental loot that makes the player feel slightly guilty for digging up the wrong one.

AD_KoboldLeavesWithoutExtraPayment.synopsis: Bugthimble has "promised" to come back with extra loot but was lying and scarpers.
AD_KoboldLeavesWithoutExtraPayment.how_to_trigger: - Read the Tough Letter from the Courier- Open Kurwin's Coffin- Intimidate Bugthimble once with knowledge of Ninefingers- Intimidate Bugthimble a second time, but fail!

TeenHoodlum01.synopsis: Drunken teen, preparing to vandalise a gravestone. If you douse them in water, they run off. If you try to talk to them, you get all their charm.

KidNecromancer.synopsis: Nina is a little girl who loved her big brother dearly. He was murdered by Dolor - the serial killer. She has some magic, and is desperately trying to bring her big brother back to life.

AD_NecromancerIdles.synopsis: Nina is a child with immense power and the favour of Myrkul. She is trying to raise her brother Garret from the dead. In the bottom set she is trying and failing to raise him - but can't figure out why it won't work. In the top set the player has convinced her to let her brother rest in peace, so now she is at his grave - sad and wishing he was with her.

KelemvorPriestess.synopsis: Mortach Scyre, Priestess of Kelemvor, is a kind and gentle older woman (who will also not hestitate to beat your ass). She can come across a little morbid, but that's simply because she is completely at peace with death in a way very few people are. She is like the shephard of the graveyard - guiding and offering help where needs be.In this dialogue, she reacts to the things you've done to help people around the graveyard (and also to chastise you in the case of Nina, if you help her raise her brother from the dead)

TeenHoodlum02.synopsis: Drunken teen, preparing to vandalise a gravestone. If you douse them in water, they run off. If you try to talk to them, you get all their charm.

FlowerSeller.synopsis: The flower merchant out front, selling flowers on the approach to the graveyard, is trying desperately to sell her stock. The only thing of interest besides her being a vendor is to imply that she gets her stock from Jaheira's house and to give the gentlest of nudges that maybe there's something over there.

AD_NecromancerRunsAway.synopsis: Nina is an in training mage, that the player has encouraged to summon the undead. Her wishes were intercepted and Myrkul toyed with it, causing her brother to rise up as an evil giant skeleton thing. Not nice. So she runs away.

PAD_MessyCorpse.synopsis: The player has dug up a body that looks particularly messy/bloody/scarred. For anyone else, this is just a simple "Ew" moment to question why you're going digging.  But for the Dark urge, they remember and are happy with it, which prompts a PAD that follows this up.
PAD_MessyCorpse.how_to_trigger: - Dig up the body in the graveyard at (TBD)- This is a quick moment just to draw attention to it. Doesn't need to be anything super involved.

AD_MourningChild.synopsis: You've dug up this poor child's mother's grave right infront of his eyes to loot it. He's quite rightly horrified. You monster.
AD_MourningChild.how_to_trigger: - Go to Kurwin Coffin- Find the child in the upper graveyard, near the house- Dig up the grave by the child- Feel all the guilt in the worldBookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_KurwinCoffin&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=3.885604;42.978622;30.843765&camTarget=4.312797;42.531807;30.057722

BereavedCouple.synopsis: The bereaved father and mother are heartbroken and grieving. Their little girl was murdered and they can't get her a coffin - the coffin maker is too backed up.

AD_BereavedCoupleSolved.synopsis: Bereaved parents AD (not with Mortarch nearby) about how their situation is now solved

AD_KoboldAttack004.synopsis: Kobold looter in the graveyard combat AD - Normal dialog they can speak when attacking

AD_PriestessHoodlumReaction.synopsis: Gracie walks past the hoodlums and tries to talk them out of it. It doesn't go well and she bemoans that she can't do anything about it.

AD_KoboldAttack003.synopsis: Kobold looter in the graveyard combat AD - Normal dialog they can speak when attacking

MourningChild.synopsis: A young child is mourning the death of their relative, and blames the cultists and the refugees. They keep bringing flowers to their grave every day to stop them turning to the undead - could be a superstition the kid believes, or could be a greedy merchant playing on his fears.
MourningChild.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Mourning Child in the graveyard

Gravekeeper.synopsis: A weary gravekeeper, absolutely exhausted at having to bury so many bodies in recent days. Would be good to have her have typical gallows humour, but be relatively kindhearted and helpful underneath it (though relatively unimportant) She will exclusively hang around the gravekeeper's house, and likely either be found sat and resting or just idly milling around a small area.Important topics:- Where you can find a shovel- Killings in Baldur's Gate (with a branch for if it's solved)- (When you've encountered them) Kobold Looters- Something to chastise the player if they've gone around digging up graves themselves, probably a HasMet alt?
Gravekeeper.how_to_trigger: Speak to the Gravekeeper in the House in the Lower City graveyard.

AD_GraveKurwin.synopsis: Simple grave narration. In Act 1, you may have found a letter to Nine-Fingers on a courier note. The note said, 'If you want your money, dig up the grave of M Kurwin. That'll settle my debt.'

BereavedFather.synopsis: A father that recently lost his child and has come to the graveyard with his wife to get a specially made coffin. In one set, the coffin maker has refused to make it as he's too busy - father is very upset. In the other set he's extremely thankful to the player for organising the coffin for his daughter.

AD_KoboldLooterDangerousWildshapeReact.synopsis: Kobold Looter has burst out of the coffin looting, only to find a wildshaped animal (dangerous) that has disturbed her.
AD_KoboldLooterDangerousWildshapeReact.how_to_trigger: - Dig up Kurwin's Coffin- Wildshape into anything not a cat/raven- Interact with/break the coffin

CoffinMaker.synopsis: An overworked coffin maker. He's gruff and unfriendly. In this dialogue, if you've spoken to the bereaved couple, you can try to convince him to make a coffin for a child.

HiredHand01.synopsis: A hired hand you can convince to work for the woodworker. Definitely not an expy of the chucklebrothers.

AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved.synopsis: Bereaved parents AD (not with Mortarch nearby) about how upset they are and how much they need a coffin.

AD_Grave1.synopsis: Simple grave narration - Player is looking for "M.Kurwin" grave, so needs to stay close to that name. Wrong graves can be dug up and there will be incidental loot that makes the player feel slightly guilty for digging up the wrong one.

AD_KoboldAttack002.synopsis: Kobold looter in the graveyard combat AD - Normal dialog they can speak when attacking

AD_KoboldLooterAngryWithPlayerLooting.synopsis: The player has tried to steal/sneak/open the coffin and take the loot while Kobold Looter is still around - prompting combat
AD_KoboldLooterAngryWithPlayerLooting.how_to_trigger: All with Kobold Looter around (after you've paid her coin)- Move the casket- Bash open the casket- Try to use the casket

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction.synopsis: The mortach goes to speak to the bereaved couple. They are upset and waiting for a coffin for their daughter. She does her best to comfort them.

AD_Grave2_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Grave2_0.text: *C Balderk. Taken by Umberlee's rage. Recovered by Her grace.*

AD_NecromancerSummonsMyrkul_0.speaker: Nina Dortmell
AD_NecromancerSummonsMyrkul_0.text: It's working! Garret, it's me! It's Nina!

AD_CoffinMakerIdles_0.speaker: Ulkov Sully
AD_CoffinMakerIdles_0.text: Not enough damn hours in the day.

AD_CoffinMakerIdles_1.speaker: Ulkov Sully
AD_CoffinMakerIdles_1.text: If this keeps up, the gravekeeper is gonna have to bury me too.

AD_CoffinMakerIdles_2.speaker: Ulkov Sully
AD_CoffinMakerIdles_2.context: NodeContext: Noticing how much work he has left to do

AD_CoffinMakerIdles_3.speaker: Ulkov Sully
AD_CoffinMakerIdles_3.text: The city is gonna be nothing but ghosts at this rate.

AD_PriestessHoodlumSolved_0.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessHoodlumSolved_0.text: |I'm so glad those delinquents have moved on.|

AD_KoboldAttack001_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldAttack001_0.text: Kill the worm brain - but I got dibs on the body!

AD_KoboldLooterInconspicuousWildshapeRea.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldLooterInconspicuousWildshapeRea.text: What's the big... idea? Huh, just some varmint.
AD_KoboldLooterInconspicuousWildshapeRea.context: NodeContext: Initially angry "What's the big idea?!" but then confused. Instead of the person you were going to shout at, there's an innocent-looking animal (eg. Rabbit.)

AD_KoboldLooterInvisibleOpenReact_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldLooterInvisibleOpenReact_0.text: What's the big - eh... Where in the Hells are they?
AD_KoboldLooterInvisibleOpenReact_0.context: NodeContext: Initially angry "What's the big idea?!" but then just confused. The person you were going to shout at is nowhere to be seen.

AD_PriestessBellReaction_0.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessBellReaction_0.text: What is that noise? Have people no respect for the dead?

HiredHand02_2.speaker: bb9abb56-34ef-4681-9e47-346d47ef63d8
HiredHand02_2.text: |Cheers for hooking us up with a job.|

HiredHand02_8.speaker: bb9abb56-34ef-4681-9e47-346d47ef63d8
HiredHand02_8.text: |Lifting, cutting, hammering. Any odd job really.|

HiredHand02_10.speaker: Player
HiredHand02_10.text: |That guy over there could use your help|

HiredHand02_14.speaker: bb9abb56-34ef-4681-9e47-346d47ef63d8
HiredHand02_14.text: |10 gold. 5 for me, 5 for me mate. We always work together.|

HiredHand02_7.speaker: bb9abb56-34ef-4681-9e47-346d47ef63d8
HiredHand02_7.text: |Oi, Paul, we got a job to do.|

HiredHand02_5.speaker: bb9abb56-34ef-4681-9e47-346d47ef63d8
HiredHand02_5.text: |You change your mind, come see Bazz.|

BuriedMan_0.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_0.text: You can tell the Stone Lord I won't be causing no more trouble. If my ma was alive, I'd swear on her life!

BuriedMan_22.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_22.text: Gods, it's you! I'm sorry for thieving ya Mr Stone Lord, sir. I'll never do it again, don't hurt me!

BuriedMan_23.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_23.text: *Cough.* Thought I was done for. Lady Luck bless ya.
BuriedMan_23.context: NodeContext: hacking, spluttering, wipping and dusting himself off after being buried alive. Not looking at player.

BuriedMan_3.speaker: Player
BuriedMan_3.text: What were you doing down there?

BuriedMan_8.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_8.text: Sightseeing. What do you think? I filched the wrong baldy and got myself buried for the trouble.
BuriedMan_8.context: NodeContext: still looking down as he finishes dusting himself off - only looks up at the end. (this is because Minsc - the guy who buried him, might be in the party)

BuriedMan_33.speaker: Minsc
BuriedMan_33.text: It is well that Minsc had no hamster for your sticky fingers to find. When Boo buries a villain, they stay that way.

BuriedMan_29.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_29.text: Oh gods, it's you. I'm so sorry mr Stone Lord sir - I'll never steal again, I swear it!
BuriedMan_29.context: NodeContext: absolutely shitting it - thinks he might get buried again

BuriedMan_30.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_30.text: Everything I've got is buried with the stiff. Take it all - as a thank you for, uh, saving me. Just don't hurt me, mr Stone Lord sir!
BuriedMan_30.context: NodeContext: panicked - would say/do anything to make sure he doesn't get put back in the ground again

BuriedMan_19.speaker: Minsc
BuriedMan_19.text: Huh. Plant a bad man in the soil, and out grows a better one. Perhaps Jaheira has taught me something.

BuriedMan_9.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_9.text: 'Stone Lord' he calls himself. More like Stone Shite.

BuriedMan_11.speaker: Player
BuriedMan_11.text: Sounds like apt punishment for thievery.

BuriedMan_4.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_4.text: A high and mighty type? Ahem, 'oh, I've learned my ways and will never steal again.' Happy?

BuriedMan_16.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_16.text: The gang boss that's been all up in Nine-Fingers' territory. He's brutal - steer clear.

BuriedMan_15.speaker: Player
BuriedMan_15.text: I've heard of him - he's a new gang boss, right?

BuriedMan_31.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_31.text: The very one - and my idiot self didn't realise 'til I was fingers-deep in his pockets. Won't be making that mistake again.

BuriedMan_13.speaker: Player
BuriedMan_13.text: 'Stone Shite'? I'll tell him you said that.

BuriedMan_26.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_26.text: You - you know baldy? I mean, I shouldn't have filched him. I'll - I'll never do it again!

BuriedMan_14.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_14.text: I'll prove it! The Stone Shi - Lord buried me with my haul. Take it all, and tell him I'm sorry!

BuriedMan_7.speaker: Player
BuriedMan_7.text: The best thanks are paid in coin.

BuriedMan_12.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_12.text: Mate, if I'd had coin I wouldn't have been robbing it in the first place, now would I?

BuriedMan_24.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_24.text: The stiff below has some doodahs. Normally I'd say finders keepers, but I'll generously leave 'em to you as thanks.

BuriedMan_20.speaker: Player
BuriedMan_20.text: You idiot, learn the signs of a dangerous mark!

BuriedMan_17.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_17.text: I got greedy, all right? But I won't make the same mistake twice - thieves' honour.

BuriedMan_1.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_1.text: Look, I ain't got much in the way of thanks but the stiff below has some fancy doodahs - you're welcome to 'em.

BuriedMan_2.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_2.text: You and me both. That's what I get for filching a baldy - the nutcase made me dig my own grave!
BuriedMan_2.context: NodeContext: still looking down as he finishes dusting himself off - only looks up at the end (this is because Minsc - the guy who buried him, might be in the party)

BuriedMan_6.speaker: Player
BuriedMan_6.text: Lady Lucky didn't help you - I did.

BuriedMan_21.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_21.text: Aye, now I'll return the favour. You see an angry looking baldy? Don't filch him. I did and it got me a stiff for a bunk-mate.
BuriedMan_21.context: NodeContext: still looking down as he finishes dusting himself off - only looks up at the end. (this is because Minsc - the guy who buried him, might be in the party)

BuriedMan_32.speaker: Gothric Rillyn
BuriedMan_32.text: Wait 'til the boys hear where I've been. No one but you is gonna believe me.

MourningDwarf_1.speaker: Droona Shveitz
MourningDwarf_1.text: They got him, honey. They got the bastard that did this to you.

MourningDwarf_2.speaker: Droona Shveitz
MourningDwarf_2.text: Thank the gods for the Watch. Who knows how many killings there'd be otherwise?

MourningDwarf_4.speaker: Droona Shveitz
MourningDwarf_4.text: My Agnes should be dancing in the market, flowers in her hair. Not here. Not like this.

MourningDwarf_3.speaker: Droona Shveitz
MourningDwarf_3.text: I hope they string up whoever did this to her.

MourningDwarf_0.speaker: Droona Shveitz
MourningDwarf_0.text: I hope the Grand Duke strings up whoever did this to her.

BereavedMother_0.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedMother_0.text: I can finally mourn for my little girl in peace. Thank you.
BereavedMother_0.context: NodeContext: little upset, but mainly grateful

BereavedMother_1.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedMother_1.text: Don't bother speaking to the gravekeeper - she won't do anything about her precious carpenter.

BereavedMother_2.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedMother_2.text: Lily was the best kid you could have asked for. I wish you could have seen her smile...
BereavedMother_2.context: NodeContext: little upset, but mainly grateful

BereavedMother_3.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedMother_3.text: If you're here for a coffin, get ready to wait.

AD_KoboldLooterLeavesWithLoot_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldLooterLeavesWithLoot_0.text: All right, that's every last shiny. Time to get gone!

AD_FlowerSeller_0.speaker: Maude
AD_FlowerSeller_0.text: Flowers every colour of the rainbow, right here!

AD_FlowerSeller_1.speaker: Maude
AD_FlowerSeller_1.text: Brighten up a loved one's grave with a bouquet, freshly picked.

AD_FlowerSeller_2.speaker: Maude
AD_FlowerSeller_2.text: Grief is hard - let flowers say what words never can.

KoboldLooter_11.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_11.text: You got cheese for brains? I told you to hop it.

KoboldLooter_73.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_73.text: 'ere! Whatcha doing? Get them sausage fingers off my crate!

KoboldLooter_24.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_24.text: What in the Hells? Were you buried in there?

KoboldLooter_30.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_30.text: I dug in, see? Looking for trinkets. Found 'em too.

KoboldLooter_17.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_17.text: And I found 'em first, so you can find your own bleedin' grave to rob.

KoboldLooter_3.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_3.text: Wonder if you've ever buried someone alive.

KoboldLooter_46.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_46.text: Owie, what you lookin' at? Rats! You look bad.

KoboldLooter_37.speaker: Narrator
KoboldLooter_37.text: *Crinckle and crack go her bones, and the shards of old bones below.*
KoboldLooter_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

KoboldLooter_41.speaker: Narrator
KoboldLooter_41.text: *Sprinkle and stamp goes the soil, piling on top of the coffin packed cosily back into the earth.*
KoboldLooter_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

KoboldLooter_51.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the ground, freshly packed soil, implying she has been re-buried.NodeContext: Mumbled sounds from beneath the earth

KoboldLooter_78.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_78.text: Resist the temptation to put her underground. Try to leave.

KoboldLooter_42.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_42.text: Ah ah ah - you can find your own bleedin' grave after you've paid the fee.
KoboldLooter_42.context: NodeContext: 'Ah ah ah' in the "No, not so fast" kind of way

KoboldLooter_57.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_57.text: It's one of them 'letting you walk away with all your blood' kinda fees. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

KoboldLooter_5.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_5.text: Knew you'd be loaded. Sticky little gnome fingers.

KoboldLooter_54.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_54.text: Now scram off - me 'n this crate got business.

KoboldLooter_27.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_27.text: I don't have that much money!

KoboldLooter_64.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_64.text: Hells no! You think I'm scared of a kobold?

KoboldLooter_29.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_29.text: Nah, but that's fine. Prefer a dead gnome to the gold anyway.

KoboldLooter_69.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_69.text: You'd ask this of me? We're practically kin.

KoboldLooter_43.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_43.text: Eh, all right. Just don't tell no one, okay?

KoboldLooter_91.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_91.text: Fine by me. I'd prefer a dead gnome to the gold anyway.

KoboldLooter_96.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_96.text: Thank goodness. You can keep it.

KoboldLooter_97.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_97.text: Yeah, well you can - wait, what?
KoboldLooter_97.context: NodeContext: Going for a triumphant "yeah, well you can fuck off" before you realise they said you could keep the crate

KoboldLooter_77.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_77.text: 's full of gold. Why don't you want it?

KoboldLooter_90.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_90.text: Curse? There ain't no - is there?

KoboldLooter_44.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_44.text: Hells, what if there is? Ol' Rummy swore he was cursed 'til the day that Tarrasque stepped on him.

KoboldLooter_85.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_85.text: No haul's worth that. To Hells with the crate and to Hells with you!

KoboldLooter_39.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_39.text: You think I got worms for brains? You smarmy, arrogant little scrat!

KoboldLooter_23.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_23.text: Oh I'm gonna cut you up so good.

KoboldLooter_80.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_80.text: This 'crate' was promised to Nine-Fingers. You don't want to steal from her, do you?

KoboldLooter_22.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_22.context: NodeContext: Scared by Nine-Fingers, but it's a frustrated 'damn it.' This was a big haul after all.

KoboldLooter_82.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_82.text: Look, I didn't know it was the lady's. How could I? Ain't no one's name on it.

KoboldLooter_59.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_59.text: So it's yours, okay? Nine-Fingers gets her crate, I get to keep breathing and everyone's good, yeah?

KoboldLooter_89.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_89.text: That depends. I charge a fee for not breaking your snout.

KoboldLooter_93.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_93.text: Oh. Yeah. Sure, just eh - wait right here.

KoboldLooter_40.context: InternalNodeContext: Kobold tunnels away and leaves the loot to the player

KoboldLooter_26.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_26.text: You what? I'll gut you for this!

KoboldLooter_86.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_86.text: Nah, I work hard to stay off the Guild's map. Don't wanna get on the lady's bad side.

KoboldLooter_56.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_56.text: Mind you, she don't know I'm here. And she won't know - not if I bury your snitchin' carcass right here!

KoboldLooter_52.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_52.text: That so? I'll just help myself, then.

KoboldLooter_13.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_13.text: I'll just take what I want from your corpse.

KoboldLooter_66.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_66.text: I didn't wanna kill no dragon kin. Doesn't mean I won't, though.

KoboldLooter_47.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_47.text: Hand it over or I'll bury you in that hole, kobold.

KoboldLooter_60.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_60.text: You'd take this from a dragon kin? Despite our shared blood?

KoboldLooter_71.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_71.text: Eh, I mean... When you put it like that...

KoboldLooter_2.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_2.text: All right, fine. Neither you nor the box're worth the trouble.
KoboldLooter_2.context: NodeContext: A little sulky, she's just lost out on her prize and trying not

KoboldLooter_7.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_7.text: The magic of dragons flows in my veins, kobold. Do not test me.

KoboldLooter_62.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_62.text: Oh yeah? I'll gut you good!

KoboldLooter_67.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_67.text: It's not a crate and it's definitely not yours.

KoboldLooter_70.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_70.text: Is too! I tunnelled in for a little thieving. Same as you, looks like.

KoboldLooter_68.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_68.text: Well, you're too late. This one's mine - you can find your own grave to rob.

KoboldLooter_61.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_61.text: I just know what you're like. All sneaky 'n tricky 'n trying to steal someone else's haul.

KoboldLooter_92.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_92.text: Well I didn't tunnel into this grave to have my haul stolen by you! Find your own pit to pillage.

KoboldLooter_50.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_50.text: What are you doing in my father's grave?!

KoboldLooter_20.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_20.text: Father? Ain't no bones in there, just gold.

KoboldLooter_6.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_6.text: 'less his bones didn't stay buried. 'less they rose up to join the Absolute. Or who knows what else...
KoboldLooter_6.context: NodeContext: Coming to a worrying realisation

KoboldLooter_36.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_36.text: No, you can keep Daddy's gold. Just don't blame me if he comes lookin' for it.

KoboldLooter_19.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_19.text: Ouuu, 'father' is it? Come to pay your respects by digging up Daddy?
KoboldLooter_19.context: NodeContext: Doesn't believe the player and is mocking their lie

KoboldLooter_76.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_76.text: Nah, didn't think so. You ain't much of a liar, but you done one thing right.

KoboldLooter_87.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_87.text: You dug a nice, big hole I can hide your stupid corpse in!

KoboldLooter_15.speaker: Player
KoboldLooter_15.text: Sorry, I'll let you rest in peace.

KoboldLooter_53.speaker: Bugthimble
KoboldLooter_53.text: Whoa whoa - not so hasty. You can piss off after you've paid my fee.

PriestessAndNecromancer_10.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_10.text: Nina, the soil reeks of Myrkul's venom. Now is the time for truth.
PriestessAndNecromancer_10.context: NodeContext: firm but not mean. She wants nina to be honest with her. Nina stands in front of her with her head low.

PriestessAndNecromancer_1.speaker: Nina Dortmell
PriestessAndNecromancer_1.text: I - I was gonna raise my big brother from the dead.
PriestessAndNecromancer_1.context: NodeContext: guilty, think she's about to be yelled at. Head low.

PriestessAndNecromancer_15.speaker: Nina Dortmell
PriestessAndNecromancer_15.context: NodeContext: confused, a little defensive - thinks the mortach is 'setting her up'

PriestessAndNecromancer_0.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_0.text: What do you miss about him?

PriestessAndNecromancer_5.speaker: Nina Dortmell
PriestessAndNecromancer_5.text: I miss... I miss his laugh. How he made everything less scary.
PriestessAndNecromancer_5.context: NodeContext: a smile at his memory even though she's sad

PriestessAndNecromancer_2.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_2.text: Do you feel that warmth in your heart at his memory? Death does not mean you are apart - he is here every time you speak of him.
PriestessAndNecromancer_2.context: NodeContext: gentle, touching her heart and then bending down to point at Nina's (she's right in front of her). Thr motach has a very comfortable relationship with death and wants nina to have the same

PriestessAndNecromancer_4.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_4.text: But necromancy does not give life - it twists death. Whatever abomination you summon will not be your brother - I swear it.
PriestessAndNecromancer_4.context: NodeContext: a hint of desperation, she knows she has only one chance to covnince nina

PriestessAndNecromancer_18.speaker: Player
PriestessAndNecromancer_18.text: She's right. Necromancy can't bring your brother back.

PriestessAndNecromancer_14.speaker: Nina Dortmell
PriestessAndNecromancer_14.text: But - but Myrkul's Book of the Dead says it's the only way.
PriestessAndNecromancer_14.context: NodeContext: hesitant, she's not so sure

PriestessAndNecromancer_8.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_8.text: Myrkul's - sweet child. How about this? We will meet every sunset to discuss and honour your brother. You will see there is peace, not fear, in death.
PriestessAndNecromancer_8.context: NodeContext: shocked at the mention of myrkul but catches herself and continues to be gentle and kind. She knows yelling at a child isn't going to fix anything.

PriestessAndNecromancer_12.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_12.text: I look forward to it. And you - thank you for alerting me to Nina's plight. I fear what would have happened had you not intervened.
PriestessAndNecromancer_12.context: NodeContext: big sincere smile for nina on the first line. Second line, turns to player - genuine relief.

PriestessAndNecromancer_20.speaker: Player
PriestessAndNecromancer_20.text: Give it a decade of practice, then try to raise him.

PriestessAndNecromancer_11.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_11.text: What? No! Nina, all the practice in the world won't change the outcome.
PriestessAndNecromancer_11.context: NodeContext: player has fucked up and encourage Nina. Mortach is panicked.

PriestessAndNecromancer_19.speaker: Nina Dortmell
PriestessAndNecromancer_19.text: Myrkul's Book of the Dead says death shouldn't be owned. It says people like you want us to be sad, and miserable. Well, I refuse!
PriestessAndNecromancer_19.context: NodeContext: upset - thinks the mortach betrayed her, runs off

PriestessAndNecromancer_17.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_17.text: Nina - come back! You've condemned a child for nothing more than your own amusement. Kelemvor's judgement upon you, wretch.
PriestessAndNecromancer_17.context: NodeContext: Nina has just run off - maybe a hand almost raised in surprised in the first line. Second line on - furious with  player

PriestessAndNecromancer_6.speaker: Player
PriestessAndNecromancer_6.text: Why raise him from the dead when you could join him? Quicker, cleaner, just a slit of the throat away!

PriestessAndNecromancer_13.speaker: Nina Dortmell
PriestessAndNecromancer_13.context: NodeContext: backs up a step, wary - wants nothing to do with player.Runs away

PriestessAndNecromancer_9.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_9.context: NodeContext: scared for nina, hand raised (she's run off cause player scared nina - mortach knows she's lost all hope of getting through to nina now)

PriestessAndNecromancer_3.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
PriestessAndNecromancer_3.text: You - these grounds are under my protection. Threaten another, and I will strike you down with the full mete of Kelemvor's judgement.
PriestessAndNecromancer_3.context: NodeContext: FURIOUS with player - who has absolutely ruined any attempt she might make to help nina.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_3.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_3.text: Tell me - you have a son, correct? Would he like to attend the death rites?

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_10.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_10.text: That would be wonderful, but our son is only two... and noisy.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_7.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_7.text: Noisy or not, I imagine your son misses his sister.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_0.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_0.text: Death is not to be feared - it is to be accepted. Embraced. Perhaps attending will help?

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_8.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_8.text: I think that's a great idea.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_4.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_4.text: Mortarch, we were wondering if we might decorate Lily's grave with her drawings.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_5.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_5.text: Honey, no - the gravekeeper said we couldn't.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_1.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_1.text: If it will be a comfort to you, then I shall speak to the gravekeeper.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_2.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_2.text: Thank you - thank you so much.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_9.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_9.text: Our little girl finally has a coffin. That - that news shouldn't make me so happy...

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_11.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_11.text: Grief's path is tumultuous - happiness plays as much a part as pain.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_12.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_12.text: You feel joy because you honour your daughter. It is a beautiful thing.

AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_6.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleSolved_6.text: When you put it like that... thanks, Mortarch.

AD_Grave4_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Grave4_0.text: *J Orchard. Artificer of Gond, crafter of odd sockets.*

AD_KoboldLooterSummonsGang_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldLooterSummonsGang_0.text: I ain't doing this by m'self. Get yer tails up here!

AD_BuriedManBell_1.context: NodeContext: trying to yell 'LET ME OUT'

KidNecromancer_5.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_5.text: The Mortarch is teaching me lots about death - and how it isn't that scary. She's a lot nicer than I thought.
KidNecromancer_5.context: NodeContext: a cautious smile, she's feeling much better

KidNecromancer_13.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_13.text: Psst - keep a lookout. The Mortarch don't take kindly to raising the dead - but I won't be long, I promise.
KidNecromancer_13.context: NodeContext: Furtive, knows if she gets caught she'll be in big trouble. She's standing in front of a large gravesite.

KidNecromancer_46.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_46.text: Who are you raising from the dead?

KidNecromancer_2.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_2.text: My big brother, Garret. He got killed by that murderer guy - but I'm gonna fix him. Now, keep watch!
KidNecromancer_2.context: NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

KidNecromancer_31.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_31.text: Exaudi me, Myrkul! Resuscita fratrem meum. E morte ad me redige eo!
KidNecromancer_31.context: NodeContext: hands held out in front of her, frowning with concentration - clearly struggling with the spell, maybe tripping up a word or two

KidNecromancer_23.speaker: Narrator
KidNecromancer_23.text: *The air crackles with power - before fizzing out. The child has power but lacks control.*

KidNecromancer_47.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_47.text: You're close, Myrkul - I can feel your shadow! Give my brother back, please.
KidNecromancer_47.context: NodeContext: drops her hands, frustrated, angry and upset

KidNecromancer_8.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_8.text: Here - this scroll might do the trick.

KidNecromancer_53.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_53.text: Really? I'm gonna try it right now!

KidNecromancer_38.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_38.text: You need to focus your power - make it a sharpened point, like the tip of an arrow.

KidNecromancer_21.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_21.context: NodeContext: raises her hands as if to cast a spell.

KidNecromancer_18.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_18.text: That's dumb - I'm using magic, not a bow.
KidNecromancer_18.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes - another dumb grown up wasting her time

KidNecromancer_41.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_41.text: I'll figure it out by myself - thanks.
KidNecromancer_41.context: NodeContext: kinda surprised player is still standing there

KidNecromancer_14.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_14.text: The spell you're looking for is 'Raise Undead'. This is how you do it...

KidNecromancer_35.speaker: Narrator
KidNecromancer_35.text: *She nods along, enraptured by your explanation.*

KidNecromancer_0.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_0.text: Ohhh, that makes way more sense. Let me try again!
KidNecromancer_0.context: NodeContext: excited, raises her hands as if to cast a spell.

KidNecromancer_1.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_1.text: Exaudi me, Myrkul! Resuscita fratrem meum. E morte ad me redige eo!
KidNecromancer_1.context: NodeContext: Hands held out in front of her at start of line. Much more confident and quick this time around. Powerful.

KidNecromancer_49.speaker: Narrator
KidNecromancer_49.text: *She blinks at your explanation, which involved hand gestures and five-syllable words.*

KidNecromancer_50.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_50.text: That sounds dumb. And wrong. I'll figure it out on my own, thanks.
KidNecromancer_50.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes - another dumb grown up wasting her time

KidNecromancer_58.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_58.text: Your brother deserves to rest in peace - let him.

KidNecromancer_34.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_34.text: The Mortarch said the same thing... but I miss him. A lot.
KidNecromancer_34.context: NodeContext: sad, but also knows the player is right

KidNecromancer_15.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_15.text: Fine. I won't try again... for now, at least.
KidNecromancer_15.context: NodeContext: knows player is right - a little unhappy about it though

KidNecromancer_43.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_43.text: No - he said we'd always have each other's backs. He promised! So butt. Out.

KidNecromancer_54.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_54.text: Raising a fallen creature? Paltry magic. Allow me to explain...

KidNecromancer_52.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_52.text: Tell the child all you know of how fiends snatch souls from the afterlife.

KidNecromancer_56.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_56.text: Magic is about instinct. Trust you gut, trust your magic - and the rest will flow.

KidNecromancer_24.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_24.text: Your brother's soul is at rest - it is not fair to disturb it. Make peace with your dead, child.

KidNecromancer_12.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_12.text: Keep trying - you'll get it eventually.

KidNecromancer_39.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_39.text: Oh, I'm not going anywhere - not until my brother is all right.
KidNecromancer_39.context: NodeContext: nodding, eager - glad tohave the player encouraging her

KidNecromancer_29.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_29.text: That was dangerous! You must never do that again.

KidNecromancer_16.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_16.text: I don't care what you say! I'm gonna save my brother!

KidNecromancer_6.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_6.text: I'm coming Garret, just hang on.
KidNecromancer_6.context: NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

KidNecromancer_32.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_32.text: You're just a child. Is this a good idea?

KidNecromancer_28.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_28.text: Well it's this or cry - which isn't gonna help my big bro. Now, keep watch!
KidNecromancer_28.context: NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

KidNecromancer_26.speaker: Player
KidNecromancer_26.text: Whatever you're doing - stop it. Magic isn't a game.

KidNecromancer_37.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_37.text: Urgh - you're worse than the Mortarch. Whatever.

KidNecromancer_19.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_19.text: I ruined it - I ruined everything.
KidNecromancer_19.context: NodeContext: sees her brother garret, a broken skeleton, just in front of her. Upset, horrified, and heartbroken.

KidNecromancer_25.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_25.text: I want you home, Garret - mam won't stop crying. And dad is always at the pub...
KidNecromancer_25.context: NodeContext: doesn't even see player - staring at the grave in front of her

KidNecromancer_57.speaker: Nina Dortmell
KidNecromancer_57.text: Hm. Maybe if I make the spell extra big. Uh, do you mind? I'm doing magic stuff.
KidNecromancer_57.context: NodeContext: first line said to herself - she has no idea what she's doing but she's gonna do her best. Sees player, doesn't know why they're standing there like a weirdo

AD_NecromancerIdles_2.speaker: Nina Dortmell
AD_NecromancerIdles_2.text: I'm gonna save you Garret - I promise.

AD_NecromancerIdles_3.speaker: Nina Dortmell
AD_NecromancerIdles_3.text: Myrkul, I can feel you. Help me - please.

AD_NecromancerIdles_4.speaker: Nina Dortmell
AD_NecromancerIdles_4.text: Mom can't even look at me.

AD_NecromancerIdles_6.speaker: Nina Dortmell
AD_NecromancerIdles_6.text: What's the point in having magic if I can't save you?

AD_NecromancerIdles_7.speaker: Nina Dortmell
AD_NecromancerIdles_7.text: It's not fair, Garret. Why was it you?

KelemvorPriestess_1.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_1.text: Tell me, saer, if you leave a poisoned cake in a park and a child dies from eating said cake, are you responsible for the child's death?

KelemvorPriestess_3.speaker: Player
KelemvorPriestess_3.text: Yes, because you should know a child can't resist the temptation.

KelemvorPriestess_20.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_20.text: Such wisdom. Which means you do not even have the excuse of ignorance.

KelemvorPriestess_35.speaker: Player
KelemvorPriestess_35.text: No, the parents are responsible. They should have taught the child better.

KelemvorPriestess_2.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_2.text: I cannot believe you truly think that.

KelemvorPriestess_9.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_9.text: You showed a grieving child the ways of necromancy. Leave these hallowed grounds now. May Kelemvor have mercy on your soul.

KelemvorPriestess_24.speaker: Player
KelemvorPriestess_24.text: In part. But the child's parents share the blame.

KelemvorPriestess_4.speaker: Player
KelemvorPriestess_4.text: It is the fault of the gods for not intervening.

KelemvorPriestess_8.speaker: Player
KelemvorPriestess_8.text: Oh, yes! But I would use ground glass and razorblades rather than poison.

KelemvorPriestess_6.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_6.text: Nina fled these grounds in tears. What should be a place of comfort and safety has been ruined by your malevolence.

KelemvorPriestess_31.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_31.text: You will attend to your business here and then leave - for you try the Lord of the Dead's patience.

KelemvorPriestess_23.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_23.text: You walk with death's mantle on your shoulders - your hand as steady as the Lord of the Dead's.

KelemvorPriestess_12.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_12.text: And for that you have my gratitude - thank you, for doing His work.

KelemvorPriestess_33.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_33.text: And for that you are owed thanks - even if I must turn a blind eye to the grave soil that muddies your shoes. You have my gratitude.

KelemvorPriestess_29.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_29.text: You did well to alert me to Nina's folly. While loss is the price of living, it is a high cost for a child to pay. I will do my best to guide her.

KelemvorPriestess_30.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_30.text: Breathe it in - the damp. The decay. The smell is sweeter than roses - for death is a gift worth cherishing.

KelemvorPriestess_36.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_36.text: Death's blessings upon you - I am Mortarch Scyre, devotee of Kelemvor.

KelemvorPriestess_15.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_15.text: How might I be of assistance?

KelemvorPriestess_37.speaker: Player
KelemvorPriestess_37.text: The young girl at the grave is trying to perform necromancy.

KelemvorPriestess_10.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_10.text: Kelemvor forgive her - there is no sin greater than refusing His deathly will. I shall speak to her - immediately.

KelemvorPriestess_27.speaker: Player
KelemvorPriestess_27.text: There's a zombie by one of the tombstones. Should you go kill it? Kelemvor isn't fond of them, right?

KelemvorPriestess_0.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_0.text: There is no greater aberration of His deathly will.

KelemvorPriestess_16.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_16.text: Fear not death, and He shall welcome you.

KelemvorPriestess_38.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_38.text: You did the girl child and her parents an honour - the dead deserve love and diligence. I shall personally oversee her rites.

KelemvorPriestess_17.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_17.text: To think a man lay buried beneath death's soil - it is an abomination of His will. You did well to free him.

KelemvorPriestess_26.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_26.text: Kobolds are a festering plague on these hallowed grounds - to disturb the dead is to invite divinity's wrath. Thank you for dealing with them.

KelemvorPriestess_28.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
KelemvorPriestess_28.text: I pray you find comfort among the dead, as I do. To rid ourselves of the coils of flesh is a beautiful thing.

TeenHoodlum02_0.speaker: 6646b63e-7185-4a07-8131-0858f1b92d8e
TeenHoodlum02_0.text: |What are you looking at? Clear off.|

FlowerSeller_0.speaker: Maude
FlowerSeller_0.text: A friendly face at a graveyard is always a treat. How about a flower or two to brighten your day?

FlowerSeller_12.speaker: Maude
FlowerSeller_12.text: Would saer like some flowers? They do a wonder at brightening up a grave. I bring fresh ones to my husband's every few days.

FlowerSeller_13.speaker: Maude
FlowerSeller_13.text: I'm not - my husband was an arse. But he gave me three beautiful kids, so the old goat gets flowers.

FlowerSeller_10.speaker: Maude
FlowerSeller_10.text: I get them up by Bloombridge - a druid lives that way, so you know they're extra fresh.

FlowerSeller_8.speaker: Player
FlowerSeller_8.text: I'd like to see your flowers.

FlowerSeller_3.speaker: Maude
FlowerSeller_3.text: Come back any time; you won't find fresher.

FlowerSeller_11.speaker: Player
FlowerSeller_11.text: What use do the dead have with flowers?

FlowerSeller_14.speaker: Maude
FlowerSeller_14.text: They're not for the dead - they're for the living. Same with funerals, coffins - all of it.

FlowerSeller_2.speaker: Maude
FlowerSeller_2.text: I put flowers on my husband's grave for me. To remember the good from the bad. We get on better now than when he was still alive.

PAD_MessyCorpse_3.speaker: Player
PAD_MessyCorpse_3.text: This is hardly even recognisable as a body, why are we digging up graves?

PAD_MessyCorpse_4.text: I can feel the intestines delicately parting for my prying fingers, the supple kidneys greeting my inquisitive claws... I think this is my work from months past.

PAD_MessyCorpse_0.text: My body calls me to kneel and slip my hand into the mulch... I think it remembers... I may have killed this one in months past.

BereavedCouple_2.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_2.text: I am not leaving until Lily has a godsdamned coffin.

BereavedCouple_12.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_12.text: I'm sorry, but our baby girl... our baby...
BereavedCouple_12.context: NodeContext: realised he's snapped at his wife - apologetic but also just flooded with grief

BereavedCouple_7.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_7.context: NodeContext: heartbroken but trying to keep it together for her husband

BereavedCouple_5.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_5.text: If you're here for a burial, good luck. The carpenter round back claims there's a 'backlog'. We asked for a child-sized coffin, but he said it'll take a month.

BereavedCouple_26.speaker: Player
BereavedCouple_26.text: You lost your child? I'm so sorry.

BereavedCouple_27.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_27.text: Seven years of age and murdered. What kind of monster hurts a little girl?
BereavedCouple_27.context: NodeContext: breaking down, sobbing at the end

BereavedCouple_24.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_24.text: Shh, love. We're going to get Lily a coffin, all right? Give her the burial she deserves.
BereavedCouple_24.context: NodeContext: speaking to husband, trying to be strong

BereavedCouple_22.speaker: Player
BereavedCouple_22.text: A month? That seems a bit excessive.

BereavedCouple_8.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_8.text: Oh, there's a 'priority' fee, but not all of us have the barrels of gold to spare. Arsehole.

BereavedCouple_17.speaker: Player
BereavedCouple_17.text: Just dig a hole and dump the body - far cheaper.

BereavedCouple_10.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_10.text: I am not dumping my seven-year-old in a hole.

BereavedCouple_19.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_19.text: Why don't you take a long walk off a short pier, yeah? Ignore them, love - they're just another arsehole.
BereavedCouple_19.context: NodeContext: first line to player, second to husband

BereavedCouple_3.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_3.text: Why is this happening? Why our baby girl?
BereavedCouple_3.context: NodeContext: doesn't even see player - heart broken and grieving

BereavedCouple_23.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_23.context: NodeContext: directed at player - angry at the interruption

BereavedCouple_6.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_6.text: I won't bury Lily without a coffin, I refuse.
BereavedCouple_6.context: NodeContext: still upset but more frustrated now than his previous lines

BereavedCouple_15.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_15.text: No one's suggesting that. We've just gotta... figure this out.
BereavedCouple_15.context: NodeContext: a little hestitan, trying to be strong for her husband

BereavedCouple_9.speaker: Player
BereavedCouple_9.text: Your daughter's coffin will be ready soon. I took care of it.

BereavedCouple_4.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_4.text: You did? You hear that, honey?

BereavedCouple_16.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_16.text: Lily was our world. Knowing that she'll be able to put to rest properly makes things... easier. Thank you.
BereavedCouple_16.context: NodeContext: first time we see her a bit upset, overwhelmed with gratitude

BereavedCouple_11.speaker: Player
BereavedCouple_11.text: The carpenter is making you one now. Don't ask questions.

BereavedCouple_21.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_21.text: He is? But why is he... why would you...

BereavedCouple_25.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_25.context: NodeContext: a gentle smile for her husband

BereavedCouple_13.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_13.text: So instead I'll say this - Lily was our world. Knowing that she'll be able to put to rest properly makes things... easier. Thank you.
BereavedCouple_13.context: NodeContext: first time we see her a bit upset, overwhelmed with gratitude

BereavedCouple_18.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_18.text: Lily... we can't leave her like this.
BereavedCouple_18.context: NodeContext: doesn't even see player - heart broken and grieving

BereavedCouple_1.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedCouple_1.text: We won't honey. We'll get her a coffin, I promise.
BereavedCouple_1.context: NodeContext: a little hestitant, knows this is a promise she can't keep, but trying to be strong for her husband

BereavedCouple_20.speaker: Anita Fischer
BereavedCouple_20.text: Thank you. I can't tell you how much it means this means to us - and to our little girl.
BereavedCouple_20.context: NodeContext: overwhelmed with gratitude, voice breaking/upset at 'little girl'

AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_1.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_1.text: What colour should we paint Lily's casket, do you think?

AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_0.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_0.text: Yellow, I think. With blue flowers?

AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_2.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_2.text: I'd like my mom to be here for the burial rites.

AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_6.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_6.text: Of course, Lily loved her nana.

AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_3.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_3.text: It doesn't feel real, does it? Lily being gone.

AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_5.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleSolved_5.text: No. But we'll give her the best send off we can.

AD_PriestessCombatAD002_0.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCombatAD002_0.text: I am the keeper of the dead - and you are not welcome here!

AD_PriestessHoodlumReaction_2.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessHoodlumReaction_2.text: |One day the Flaming Fist will come by and stop them. One day.|

AD_KoboldAttack003_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldAttack003_0.text: A toughie, eh? Good. They've got the best loot!

MourningChild_0.speaker: Billyum
MourningChild_0.text: I put a candle in the box with her. She never liked the dark.

MourningChild_2.speaker: Billyum
MourningChild_2.text: I got you some flowers, mum. I know you like the blue ones, so I asked if they had any blue ones.

MourningChild_3.speaker: Billyum
MourningChild_3.text: They didn't. But I'll ask again tomorrow.

MourningChild_4.speaker: Billyum
MourningChild_4.text: They got the bad man, mum, so we're safe now. You don't have to worry about me. I'll be okay.
MourningChild_4.context: NodeContext: Choking up a little at the end

Gravekeeper_19.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_19.text: I am sorry for your loss, but it will be a tenday before I can take your departed. Maybe more.

Gravekeeper_76.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_76.text: If you notice any odours before then, treat the body with jasmine, honeysuckle - whatever you can get.

Gravekeeper_47.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_47.text: Pah, there usually isn't much left once I'm done with a body.

Gravekeeper_67.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_67.text: Think I'm not used to deviants like you in my graveyard? You aren't special, you know.

Gravekeeper_1.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_1.text: My dear, precious sister perished recently! Is there nothing that can be done?

Gravekeeper_26.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_26.text: I don't have a plot left to sell you, yet alone the time to schedule a burial.

Gravekeeper_23.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_23.text: I hope you have other family to provide you some comfort as you mourn.

Gravekeeper_46.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_46.text: I'm looking for a grave. Name of M Kurwin?

Gravekeeper_61.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_61.text: Kurwin? Oh, yes - he's just outside, under the great willow with the drooping branches.

Gravekeeper_56.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_56.text: It's good of you to come. He hasn't had any visitors in a long time.

Gravekeeper_20.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_20.text: Just want to pay my respects.

Gravekeeper_0.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_0.text: It's important to remember those who have gone before us. I wish there were more like you.

Gravekeeper_74.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_74.text: Great! Now, do you have a shovel I can borrow?

Gravekeeper_30.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_30.text: A shovel? Tell me you're joking.

Gravekeeper_12.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_12.text: I'm not joking and I'm done asking. Give me a shovel.

Gravekeeper_41.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_41.text: There - there's one by the grand mausoleum. Down the steps, past the fountain.

Gravekeeper_13.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_13.text: You think you can scare me? You think there is anything I have not seen?
Gravekeeper_13.context: NodeContext: Amused that the player thinks they can intimidate you

Gravekeeper_34.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_34.text: This is a house of peace and respect - you are interested in neither. Get out.

Gravekeeper_25.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_25.text: I need it to tidy up some of the older graves. I hate to see them neglected.

Gravekeeper_53.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_53.text: I might need to tidy up Kurwin's grave. You said it hadn't been cared for.

Gravekeeper_16.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_16.text: The kobolds made a real mess out there. I'd like to help clean it up.

Gravekeeper_48.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_48.text: That's... very kind, actually. Thank you.

Gravekeeper_5.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_5.text: If you go down all the steps, past the fountain, you'll find the grand mausoleum. There should be one there.
Gravekeeper_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Points the player towards the fancy part of the graveyard, with the overly large gold/grey roofed mausoleum near the extravagent statue and the small pond feature

Gravekeeper_21.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_21.text: I have no time for this - get out before I call the Watch!

Gravekeeper_44.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_44.context: NodeContext: Annoyed at the player, responding to them saying "I'll just go"

Gravekeeper_69.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_69.text: I hear there's a serial killer out there. No wonder you're busy.

Gravekeeper_66.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_66.text: Yes and no. The murders were terrible, but all causes of death are on the rise.

Gravekeeper_7.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_7.text: More killed in bar fights, more killed at home, more attacks on strangers.

Gravekeeper_28.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_28.text: Fear is taking more lives than any cult. Everyone is on edge, watching each other, and ready to draw steel.

Gravekeeper_33.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_33.text: It sounds like you're pretty busy.

Gravekeeper_36.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_36.text: Well, there is a serial killer on the loose. Business is booming, unfortunately.

Gravekeeper_71.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_71.text: Can't say. There are a hundred theories, but I see no pattern in who comes through my door.

Gravekeeper_8.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_8.text: Mind you, fear is taking more lives than any one killer. The whole city is on edge, ready to draw steel.

Gravekeeper_35.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_35.text: I only hope the worst is behind us now that this killer has been dealt with.

Gravekeeper_22.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_22.text: Did you know there were kobolds looting your graves?

Gravekeeper_45.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_45.text: I saw. I saw their bodies, too. Your doing, I take it.

Gravekeeper_40.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_40.text: I'm grateful that the people in my garden can rest in peace, but I wish there'd been another way. There's been so much death already.
Gravekeeper_40.context: NodeContext: Weary on "there's been so much death already"

Gravekeeper_37.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_37.text: And now I have to look up kobold burial rituals.

Gravekeeper_10.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_10.text: Do you know there are kobolds looting your graves?

Gravekeeper_72.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_72.text: It is hard to miss, but what can I do? The Watch is too busy to help and I will not fight these thieves.

Gravekeeper_43.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_43.text: Let them have their baubles if they must. That the bones are left to rest is what matters to me.

Gravekeeper_14.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_14.text: I need to borrow a shovel, actually.

Gravekeeper_3.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_3.text: There's some strange things happening in this graveyard.

Gravekeeper_55.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_55.text: I deal with the dead, but the Mortarch tends to them, and the living who mourn them.
Gravekeeper_55.context: NodeContext: busy, doesn't reall have time for this, trying to be polite

Gravekeeper_65.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_65.text: If you have any concerns about 'strange' goings on, kindly speak to her - she patrols the graveyard. Good day.

Gravekeeper_31.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_31.text: You steal from those resting in my garden and still expect an audience? Get out.
Gravekeeper_31.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs a "Did a grave robbing" flag - remove 'IMPOSSIBLE' flag once that's in|

Gravekeeper_64.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_64.text: Leave me be. You are not welcome in this place.

Gravekeeper_75.speaker: Valmorba
Gravekeeper_75.text: I am sorry for your loss, but - oh, you're back?
Gravekeeper_75.context: NodeContext: Repeating her line from earlier ("I am sorry for your loss, but it will be a tenday before I can take your departed") when she realises she's met the player before

Gravekeeper_4.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_4.text: I took care of those grave-robbing kobolds for you.

Gravekeeper_17.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_17.text: I hear there's a serial killer out there.

Gravekeeper_57.speaker: Player
Gravekeeper_57.text: Yes, I just need to borrow a shovel.

AD_GraveKurwin_0.speaker: Player
AD_GraveKurwin_0.text: I know that name - it was in a courier's note. Something about 'settling matters' with Nine-Fingers.

BereavedFather_0.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedFather_0.text: My little girl is gonna get a proper burial - all because of you. I can't thank you enough.

BereavedFather_1.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedFather_1.context: NodeContext: upset, doesn't even notice player

BereavedFather_2.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedFather_2.text: I'm gonna buy Lily some flowers - make her grave as pretty as she was. I promise.

BereavedFather_3.speaker: Elias Fischer
BereavedFather_3.text: My girl... my sweet baby girl...
BereavedFather_3.context: NodeContext: upset, doesn't even notice player

AD_KoboldLooterDangerousWildshapeReact_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldLooterDangerousWildshapeReact_0.text: What's the big - agh! Get back, you stupid beast!
AD_KoboldLooterDangerousWildshapeReact_0.context: NodeContext: Initially angry "What's the big idea?!" but then alarmed. Instead of the person you were going to shout at, there's a ferocious animal (eg. Bear).

CoffinMaker_3.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_3.text: Fully booked. And no, I don't care if your loved one was drowned, strangled, or butchered - I'm not making you a coffin.
CoffinMaker_3.context: NodeContext: gruff, has had this same confo many times - apathetic

CoffinMaker_24.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_24.text: Not even for a child? That couple is really upset.

CoffinMaker_47.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_47.text: Why? 'Cause they have a dead kid? Welcome to half the city.
CoffinMaker_47.context: NodeContext: acts gruff, apathetic shrug, but he's saying this because he ALSO lost a kid

CoffinMaker_6.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_6.text: Now, you want to bump someone else to the back of the queue? Fine - but it'll cost you. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
CoffinMaker_6.context: NodeContext: apathetic - he doesn't care, he just wants to get paid

CoffinMaker_23.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_23.text: Compassion doesn't make coffins. That said, I could bump someone else to the back of the queue.
CoffinMaker_23.context: NodeContext: apathetic, shrug - he just wants to get paid

CoffinMaker_12.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_12.context: NodeContext: apathetic - he doesn't care, he just wants to get paid

CoffinMaker_15.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_15.text: Done. It'll be ready in a couple of hours. Now, clear off.

CoffinMaker_39.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_39.text: This is for a child - an innocent soul. Make a coffin - it's the right thing to do.

CoffinMaker_28.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_28.text: This is for a kid - please. How would you feel if you lost a child?

CoffinMaker_26.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_26.text: I have lost a kid. And I gave him the best send-off I could.
CoffinMaker_26.context: NodeContext: looking away, lost in the memory - the most sincere we see him. Emotional.

CoffinMaker_29.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_29.text: Bloody hells, fine. Tell them they can pick it up at sunset. Now, get out of my sight.
CoffinMaker_29.context: NodeContext: rallies himself after an unexpected show of emotion. A little gruff but not mean at all

CoffinMaker_35.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_35.text: I'd make the damn thing myself - not bother good, hard-working people who are barely making ends meet.

CoffinMaker_0.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_0.text: Now, bugger off and let me do my damn job.

CoffinMaker_44.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_44.text: You can either make those parents a coffin or I'll bury you alive.

CoffinMaker_34.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_34.text: Really? A man can't even work in peace now without being threatened, is it?

CoffinMaker_4.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_4.text: Fine. They can pick it up at sunset. Now, bugger off before I change my mind.

CoffinMaker_9.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_9.text: Congratulations, you've just guaranteed that I'm making you and the weepy duo nothing. Get out of my sight.

CoffinMaker_16.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_16.text: Please - only the simplest coffin is needed to ease the parents' suffering.

CoffinMaker_48.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_48.text: 'Spose I've still got the smaller coffin designs from when... Ahem.
CoffinMaker_48.context: NodeContext: remembering the coffin he designed for his own child, gets choked up at ahem

CoffinMaker_40.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_40.text: Look, mate. Them getting the right coffin won't ease shit. Trust me.
CoffinMaker_40.context: NodeContext: levelling with the player - he knows this won't help them, it didn't help him when he lost his kid

CoffinMaker_50.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_50.text: How about I show you a more traditional burial? Though your skin might not like the flames.

CoffinMaker_11.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_11.text: I don't have that kind of gold.

CoffinMaker_8.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_8.text: Then you'll have to wait like everybody else.
CoffinMaker_8.context: NodeContext: annoyed - the player wasted his time for nothing

CoffinMaker_42.speaker: Player
CoffinMaker_42.text: I'm not leaving without a coffin.

CoffinMaker_31.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_31.text: Then you'll be a long time standing.

CoffinMaker_5.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_5.text: I already said I'd make the kid's coffin. Bugger off, will you?
CoffinMaker_5.context: NodeContext: a little gruff, annoyed at the interruption, not the player

CoffinMaker_43.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_43.text: The city is chock-a-block with bodies thanks to these murders. I can barely keep up with all the orders.

CoffinMaker_51.speaker: Ulkov Sully
CoffinMaker_51.text: Do you mind? These coffins won't make them damn selves.

HiredHand01_11.speaker: ca9c4d14-431c-4e73-88a3-a0c880094d05
HiredHand01_11.text: |Ee, dear. Can't believe we lost that last job.|

HiredHand01_8.speaker: ca9c4d14-431c-4e73-88a3-a0c880094d05
HiredHand01_8.text: |Mostly cutting, but me and Bazz here can give it the old "to me to you" and lift if you need.|

HiredHand01_10.speaker: Player
HiredHand01_10.text: |That guy over there could use your help|

HiredHand01_14.speaker: ca9c4d14-431c-4e73-88a3-a0c880094d05
HiredHand01_14.text: |Gotta pay the price though. 5 gold. Each.|

HiredHand01_7.speaker: ca9c4d14-431c-4e73-88a3-a0c880094d05
HiredHand01_7.text: |Cheers! Right, come on Bazz, work to do.|

AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_1.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_1.text: We're going to fix this - for Lily.

AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_2.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_2.context: NodeContext: A little hesitant as she has no idea how to fix this.

AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_6.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_6.text: It's not enough that Lily is dead. Now we can't even bury her.

AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_5.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_5.text: How? Our baby girl deserves a proper burial, damn it!

AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_8.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_8.text: It's a graveyard - how can they be out of coffins?

AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_7.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_BereavedCoupleUnsolved_7.text: Too busy to make a coffin for a child?

AD_KoboldAttack002_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldAttack002_0.text: Bugthimble don't back down for nothing!

AD_KoboldLooterAngryWithPlayerLooting_0.speaker: Bugthimble
AD_KoboldLooterAngryWithPlayerLooting_0.text: Oi, hands off! That's mine, that is!

AD_StatuePlaque_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_StatuePlaque_0.text: *A statue of Jergal, Lord of the End of Everything. The final scribe of the fate of the deceased.*

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_0.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_0.text: Mortarch, do you know of another graveyard we could use?

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_10.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_10.text: I do, but they struggle as we do - you'll not find a casket for your daughter there.

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_2.speaker: Elias Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_2.text: This is ridiculous! I just want to bury my little girl in peace.

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_3.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_3.text: I understand - I will do what I can.

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_4.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_4.text: Mortarch, any luck with the carpenter?

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_12.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_12.text: I fear not, my child. Your daughter's casket will have to wait.

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_9.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_9.text: Her rites will be said. Her body made one with the soil. Try not to focus on the how or when.

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_1.speaker: Anita Fischer
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_1.text: Shh, honey. The Mortarch is here.

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_11.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_11.text: Do not stem your cries. Sob, roar, scream - do what you must in the tangles of grief.

AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_8.speaker: Mortarch Gracie Scyre
AD_PriestessCoupleReaction_8.text: I will leave you for now, but I shall not be far - death's blessing upon you.
